articles.author: Robin Emmott
articles.title: Europeans set to toughen Iran response over nuclear violations - diplomats
articles.description: European parties to the 2015 Iran nuclear deal could launch a dispute resolution process this week that might lead to renewed U.N. sanctions on Tehran, European diplomats said.
articles.content:
BRUSSELS/PARIS (Reuters) - European parties to the 2015 Iran nuclear deal could launch a dispute resolution process this week that might lead to renewed U.N. sanctions on Tehran, European diplomats said.

articles.title: U.S. warns citizens in Israel of rocket fire risk
articles.description: The United States warned its citizens in Israel and the Palestinian territories on Monday to be vigilant, citing the risk of rocket fire, three days after a U.S. drone strike killed an Iranian military commander in Iraq.
articles.content:
JERUSALEM (Reuters) - The United States warned its citizens in Israel and the Palestinian territories on Monday to be vigilant, citing the risk of rocket fire, three days after a U.S. drone strike killed an Iranian military commander in Iraq.

articles.author: Lisa Rapaport
articles.title: Many young women get unnecessary pelvic exams
articles.description: (Reuters Health) - Although guidelines say most women under age 21 don't need pelvic exams or cervical cancer screenings, a U.S. study suggests many still get these invasive tests.
articles.content:
(Reuters Health) - Although guidelines say most women under age 21 don’t need pelvic exams or cervical cancer screenings, a U.S. study suggests many still get these invasive tests. 
Nationwide, an estimated 1.4 million such women get potentially unnecessary … [+3909 chars]

articles.title: Ghosn did not use French documents to travel to Lebanon: French minister

articles.content:

articles.title: China's U.N. ambassador urges U.S. not to use more force in Middle East
articles.description: China's ambassador to the United Nations on Monday urged the United States not to escalate tensions in the Middle East with more military force after a U.S. strike in Iraq killed a top Iranian commander last week.
articles.content:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - China’s ambassador to the United Nations on Monday urged the United States not to escalate tensions in the Middle East with more military force after a U.S. strike in Iraq killed a top Iranian commander last week.
